Wardyń  () is a village in the administrative district of Gmina Choszczno, within Choszczno County, West Pomeranian Voivodeship, in north-western Poland. It lies approximately  east of Choszczno (Arnswalde) and  south-east of the regional capital Szczecin (Stettin).
For the history of the region, see History of Pomerania.
